QAPair.Question: What is (are) Tailbone trauma ?
QAPair.Answer: Tailbone trauma is an injury to the small bone at the lower tip of the spine.

QAPair.Question: What to do for Tailbone trauma ?
QAPair.Answer: Actual fractures of the tailbone (coccyx) are not common. Tailbone trauma usually involves bruising of the bone or pulling of the ligaments.

QAPair.Question: What causes Tailbone trauma ?
QAPair.Answer: Backward falls onto a hard surface, such as a slippery floor or ice, are the most common cause of this injury.
